sentences: Harvard-MIT Division of Health Sciences and Technology
HST.071: Human Reproductive Biology
Course Director: Professor Henry Klapholz
HST 071
[H1] IN SUMMARY.
[H1] FEMALE REPRODUCTIVE SYSTEM.
[H1] FEMALE PELVIC ANATOMY.
[H1] UTERUS.
[LIST_ITEM] Composed of smooth muscle, collagen connective tissue, vessels, nerves, lymphatics
[LIST_ITEM] Corpus - body (mainly smooth muscle) Cervix (neck) - mainly collagen Supported by utero-sacral ligaments, cardinal ligaments
[LIST_ITEM] Round ligaments - no supportive value
[LIST_ITEM] Broad ligament – not a ligament but rather two layers of peritoneum containing vessels, lymphatics
[LIST_ITEM] Space between leaves of broad ligament are extra peritoneal Lymphatic of cervix drain to base of broad ligament Lymphatic of upper uterus drain to ovarian plexus
[LIST_ITEM] Ovaries are BEHIND uterus and usually lie in cul-de-sac
[LIST_ITEM] Blood supply: uterine arteries (ascending and descending branches, ovarian vessels
[LIST_ITEM] Ureter travels UNDER the uterine vessels ("water runs under bridge")
[LIST_ITEM] Ureter is about 1.5 cm from cervix (easily injured during hysterectomy)
[LIST_ITEM] Bladder and urethra above uterus – may prolapse into vagina (urethrocele, cystocele)
[LIST_ITEM] May cause urinary stress incontinence (loss of urine with cough or sneeze)
[LIST_ITEM] Short female urethra may result in urinary tract infections
[LIST_ITEM] Perineum innervated by S2,3,4 by branches of pudendal nerve
[LIST_ITEM] Genitofemoral nerve innervates the upper vulva
[H1] HISTOLOGY.
[LIST_ITEM] Portio of cervix – stratified squamous epithelium, originally was columnar epithelium that underwent squamous metaplasia
[LIST_ITEM] May contain "Nabothian cysts" – glands that became obstructed through overlying squamous metaplasia – normal finding of no significance
[LIST_ITEM] Cervical canal lined with ciliated columnar epithelium with crypts that extend into the collagenous lamina propria
[LIST_ITEM] Endometrium consists of columnar epithelium that undergoes hormonal change each month and ultimately sheds (known as "decidua")
[H1] ABNORMAL BLEEDING.
[LIST_ITEM] Menorrhagia - excessive at regular intervals
[LIST_ITEM] Menometrorrhagia - excessive at regular intervals
[LIST_ITEM] Intermenstrual Bldg - between normal cycles
[LIST_ITEM] Polymenorrhea - <21 day intervals
[LIST_ITEM] Oligomenorrhea - >35 day intervals
[LIST_ITEM] Hypomenorrhea - regular but small amounts
[LIST_ITEM] Postmenopausal – unanticipated after one year of amenorrhea
[LIST_ITEM] Pregnancy related, Infection, Neoplasm, Hormonal, Iatrogenic, Systemic
